email_chain.subject: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I hope this email finds you well. I’m reaching out regarding your inquiry for a crude oil shipment from Houston to Rotterdam. We have a suitable vessel, the MV Ocean Star, with a DWT of 150,000 and an LOA of 280 meters. The laycan is October 20-25. Our starting freight quote is in the low 50s ($50.50 per metric ton). Let me know if this works for you or if you’d like to discuss further. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the quick response. The vessel details look good, but the freight rate is a bit higher than we were hoping for. Would you be able to come down to the mid-40s? Also, can you confirm the laytime and demurrage terms? Looking forward to your reply. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, thanks for your feedback. I understand your concerns about the rate. After discussing with the owner, we can offer $48.75 per metric ton, which is a significant reduction. Laytime is 72 hours total, and demurrage is set at $25,000 per day pro rata. Let me know if this works for you. Best, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for the revised offer. $48.75 is more in line with our expectations. However, could we push the laycan to October 22-27? Also, can we agree on a demurrage rate of $20,000 per day? Let me know your thoughts. Best, John

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, I’ve confirmed with the owner, and we can adjust the laycan to October 22-27. However, the demurrage rate of $25,000 is non-negotiable due to the vessel’s operational costs. Let me know if this is acceptable, and we can proceed with the fixture. Best regards, Sarah

email_chain.subject: Re: Freight Inquiry for Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi Sarah, thanks for your flexibility on the laycan. We can accept the demurrage rate of $25,000. Let’s proceed with the fixture at $48.75 per metric ton. Please send over the recap for review. Cheers, John

email_chain.subject: Fixture Recap - Crude Oil Shipment
email_chain.body: Hi John, great news! Attached is the fixture recap for your review. To summarize: Vessel: MV Ocean Star, DWT: 150,000, LOA: 280m. Cargo: Crude Oil, 140,000 MT. Load Port: Houston, Discharge Port: Rotterdam. Laycan: October 22-27. Freight Rate: $48.75/MT. Demurrage: $25,000/day. Please confirm if everything looks good. Best, Sarah
